content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences or recommendations, but I can suggest some places that are known for their excellent food in Hokkaido. 

One of the best places for fresh seafood is the Nijo Fish Market in Sapporo, where you can find a wide variety of seafood, from crabs to sea urchins to squid, all freshly caught from the nearby waters. Sapporo Ramen Yokocho is an alley that's famous for its ramen shops and is perfect for trying different types of local ramen. Another must-visit location is the Tanukikoji Shopping Street in Sapporo, which is famous for its selection of local Hokkaido cuisine, confectionery, and souvenirs.

For a unique dining experience, you could try the jingisukan (grilled lamb dish) at Daruma in Sapporo or Kitaichi Hall in Asahikawa. If you're a fan of Japanese-style hot pot, you can try Ishikari Nabe at restaurants like Yurigakuro in Sapporo or Kakizaki Shokudo in Otaru.

In conclusion, Hokkaido has many restaurants and markets that offer excellent food, and the places mentioned above are just a few of many options to explore. With its rich culinary traditions and premium ingredients, Hokkaido is a foodie's paradise, and there's no shortage of places to try Hokkaido's distinctive cuisine.
